page.title: 19The White Swan, Harringworth
page.content:
In this pub, which also has a warm, appealing atmosphere,there are three rooms for accommodation. Customers come for 'Bed and Breakfast' as well as longer stays. Hot and cold food is served, and the local Ruddles beers plus Marstons ales are served.
The building itself is of historical interest, being built in Tudor times, and still sporting two priest's holes. Walter de la Mare, the poet, has apparently carved his name on the stone fireplace, and many other names and dates can be seen carved on the walls.
